snippet: Speaker John A. Boehner suggested on Thursday that candidates and personalities – not Republican proposals on Medicare and spending cuts – contributed to party losses in November.
abstract: Republican House Speaker John A Boehner says election losses in November will not deter his party from pressing its vision of reducing size of government and turning government health care programs largely over to private sector, with no more tax hikes; says candidates and personalities, not Republican proposals on Medicare and spending cuts, accounted for party's defeats.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: Speaker John A. Boehner suggested on Thursday that candidates and personalities – not Republican proposals on Medicare and spending cuts – contributed to party losses in November.

headline.seo: Boehner Stands Firm on Spending and Taxes
headline.main: Boehner Says Losses in Election Won’t Affect Budget Stance
headline.print_headline: Boehner Stands Firm On Spending and Taxes
